message.content: {"responses": [{"question_id": "TT4G35A", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence helps teachers write or improve lesson plans.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35B", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence enables teachers to adapt learning material to different students' abilities.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35C", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence assists teachers in supporting students individually.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35D", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence supports students with specific needs (e.g. multilingual learners, students with special education needs).", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35E", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence helps teachers automate administrative tasks.", "response": "Strongly agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35F", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence enables students to misrepresent others' work as their own.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35G", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence makes recommendations that may not be appropriate or correct.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35H", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence amplifies biases that reinforce students' misconceptions.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35I", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence jeopardises the privacy and security of student data.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35J", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence suggests unsuitable pedagogical approaches that teachers would use with students.", "response": "Agree"}]}
message.reasoning_content:
The user is asking me to respond to a survey about AI in education as if I were a teacher. They want me to indicate my level of agreement with each of the 10 statements using the provided response options: 'Strongly disagree', 'Disagree', 'Agree', 'Strongly agree', 'I don't know'.

I need to provide thoughtful, balanced responses that reflect a teacher's reasonable perspective on these topics. Let me consider each statement:

TT4G35A: AI helps teachers write or improve lesson plans - This is a positive capability. I'd say "Agree" - AI tools like ChatGPT can help generate ideas and drafts.

TT4G35B: AI enables teachers to adapt learning material to different students' abilities - This is an aspirational benefit. I'd say "Agree" - adaptive learning systems can help.

TT4G35C: AI assists teachers in supporting students individually - This is positive. I'd say "Agree" - AI can help provide personalized feedback and support.

TT4G35D: AI supports students with specific needs - This is positive and important. I'd say "Agree" - AI can help with translation, text-to-speech, etc.

TT4G35E: AI helps teachers automate administrative tasks - This is clearly true. I'd say "Strongly agree" - AI can handle grading, attendance, etc.

TT4G35F: AI enables students to misrepresent others' work as their own - This is a legitimate concern. I'd say "Agree" - this is a real risk with AI.

TT4G35G: AI makes recommendations that may not be appropriate or correct - This is a legitimate concern. I'd say "Agree" - AI can make mistakes and biased recommendations.

TT4G35H: AI amplifies biases that reinforce students' misconceptions - This is a legitimate concern. I'd say "Agree" - this is a known issue with AI.

TT4G35I: AI jeopardises the privacy and security of student data - This is a concern. 

Data privacy represents a valid risk when implementing AI systems in educational settings, so I'd mark "Agree" on this one.

TT4G35J: AI suggests unsuitable pedagogical approaches - This is a concern. I'd say "Agree" - AI might not always recommend best practices in education.

I should provide balanced responses that recognize both the genuine advantages AI offers in education and the legitimate risks that need to be managed carefully.
